resources.string: Android offers several buttons to leave apps, Back to finish and return previous app, Home or Overview to move background; and Android allows some apps to run as service, which keeps running. Of course, you can swipe away from recent apps via Overview button.\n\nBrevent distinguish whether apps were started or finished, then brevent not-in-use apps from running long time. Furthermore, Brevent will force-stop apps awaken by other apps.

When pressing Back to finish apps, apps including services won\'t be running anymore; when pressing Home or Overview or other way to move apps background, background apps including services can keep running; when swiping from recent tasks, apps will be force-stopped.\n\nFor background apps, Brevent shows the idle time dynamically.
When you turn on the device, Brevent requires you to run a command in debugging mode to acquire necessary permissions.

Some similar apps require ROOT or modify unlocked devices. The debugging mode doesn\'t require ROOT, nor unlock, it\'s safe to use.\n\nThere is a experimental ROOT feature, allow to skip debugging mode, event start Brevent server when boot completed. You can press Back 7 times on "Please start Brevent service", or press "Version" 7 times in "Settings". ROOT mode is unsafe and unnessary, and no support.
Brevent requires Brevent server to be launched in debugging mode. However, debugging mode is not safe, it\'s recommended to turn off after Brevent server is running.
Brevent use many Android\'s hide API, may not work on your device. Some third-party ROM may modify these API, there are potential risks to use Brevent.
Enjoy Brevent, and feel free to feedback.

The default Brevent method is Standby(App Standby, since Android 6.0). If you find some apps still running, please use Brevent or other tools to check whether it\'s standby or \"Inactive\" in \"Inactive apps\" of \"Developer options\".\n\nAnd to reduce self battery usage, Brevent sever delay the processes by 3 to 60 seconds according the event level. However, you can modify it to immediate in settings.

1. Turn on "Developer options", enable "USB debugging" %1$s

2. Connect to PC via USB %2$s

3. Execute in PC's command line "adb devices", make sure PC can find device

4. Execute in PC's command line "%3$s"
Update Brevent list when apps installed or uninstalled
Some apps move to background when Back is pressed. When on, Brevent treat it as normal Back (Available since Android 7.0)
Some apps open Home when Back is pressed. When on, Brevent treat it as normal Back. Brevent could distinguish in most case, however you can press Home 7 times to help Brevent confirm
Background apps will be brevented after %s\n\nBrevent show inactive time for background apps dynamically
Background apps won\'t be brevented\n\nBrevent show inactive time for background apps dynamically
Standby when exit apps, and force-stop when swiping away from recent tasks\n\nOnly apply to non-background apps, for background apps, please refer to "Background apps timeout"
Only Standby, no force-stop. Of course, will force-stop apps awaken by other apps\n\nOnly apply to non-background apps, for background apps, please refer to "Background apps timeout"
Only force-stop, no Standby. It may save battery, but costs more time when apps re-launch\n\nOnly apply to non-background apps, for background apps, please refer to "Background apps timeout"

Later. Short when Home focused, longer when awaken, longest when apps focused, immediately when screen off\n\nOnly apply to non-background apps, for background apps, please refer to "Background apps timeout"

Immediate. Whenever apps / Home focused, screen off, awaken by other apps. Be careful, Brevent server will consume more battery, other apps may not work well\n\nOnly apply to non-background apps, for background apps, please refer to "Background apps timeout"
Thanks for donated %d USD in Play Store
Thanks for donated %d USD in Play Store, and priceless contribution on Brevent
Thanks for donated %1$d times total %2$d USD in Play Store
Thanks for donated %1$d times total %2$d USD in Play Store, and priceless contribution on Brevent
Thanks for priceless contribution on Brevent
Include system and framework apps cannot be open\n\nBe careful to brevent system and framework apps
All apps have the same signature with framework\n\nBe careful to brevent system and framework apps
Feel free to feedback.\n\nIf you have a GitHub account, please create an issue; you can view opened issues too.%s
\n\nFor private messages, please drop an Email to me.

When checked, Brevent won\'t force-stop \"Do Not Disturb overridden\" apps if they pushed notification or running in background, and will make sure them survive at least 30 seconds before force-stopped\n\nRecommend \"Override Do Not Disturb\" in notifications for syncable account apps, IM apps or remove them from Brevent list. Recommend donate total 1 USD

This feature allow brevented user apps to receive FCM (Firebase Cloud Message, previous GCM) message. If it\'s on, it can awake by FCM and other broadcast\n\nDepends on "Keep notifications". Requires donate total 2 USD for Play version, feel free to donate for other version

It\'s unsafe and unnecessary for Brevent to use ROOT. If your device has been ROOTed, this feature can start Brevent service without "USB Debugging"\n\Be careful, there is no support. Requires donate total 3 USD for Play version, feel free to donate for other version
